artist: Artist: Wenceslaus Hollar; Artist: After a follower of Hans Holbein the Younger
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: chaotic scene within a walled courtyard: a small group of nude figures at R, one holding a set of stone tablets; figure with staff kneeling over another figure; a beaked figure attempts to enter the doorway in the R wall under a string of papers; two demons peek over wall from outside
inscription:
Inscription

inscribed in plate at bottom: [Lo the Popes kitchin where his Soules are fried, / Call\'d Purgatorie, see his pardons tied / on stringes; his Triple-Crowne the Divell weares, / And ore the dore the Popes owne Armes hee beares.] 

numbered in plate at lower right: [15]
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Christ's Descent into Hell, From the Satirical Passion
